Q: What is your data retention policy for deleted resources?
A: Deleted databases and file objects enter a 14-day soft-delete state, during which you can self-restore without opening a ticket. After 14 days, data is purged from primary storage and off-site backups within 30 days, in line with GDPR requirements.

raw_results.content:
Q: How do I permanently close my account?
A: You must first delete all active projects. Then, under **Settings → Account → Close Account**, confirm the action by typing your organisation name. A final confirmation email is sent; once confirmed, the account is deactivated within 24 hours and billing stops.

question: I want to get my money back

Semantic Only.answer:
To get your money back, you can follow these steps if you're on a month-to-month plan and we missed our Service Level Agreement (SLA):
1. Initiate the request via **Settings → Plan & Subscriptions → Cancel → Refund Review**.

If you're on an annual upfront plan and wish to cancel within 30 days, you can also receive a prorated refund minus used-month charges:
1. Follow the same steps mentioned above for cancellation.

In case you need a permanent data erasure when closing your account, submit a **Right to Erasure** request from **Settings → Privacy**, or email [privacy@cloudsphere.com](mailto:privacy@cloudsphere.com) with your organization ID.

Q: How can I request permanent data erasure when closing my account?
A: Submit a **Right to Erasure** request from **Settings → Privacy**, or email [privacy@cloudsphere.com](mailto:privacy@cloudsphere.com) with your organisation ID. We will complete erasure within 30 days and send written confirmation once all backups age out.

question: How much does Professional tier cost?

Semantic Only.answer: The Professional tier costs $149 per month.
Semantic Only.context:
Q: Which products and add-ons are included in each pricing tier?
A: **Essential** (\$49 / month) covers 2 vCPU, 4 GB RAM, 100 GB storage, and community support. **Professional** (\$149 / month) raises limits to 8 vCPU, 16 GB RAM, 500 GB storage, adds autoscaling, and 24 × 5 chat support. **Enterprise** (from \$499 / month) offers dedicated clusters, unlimited storage, custom SLAs, SAML-based SSO, and a named technical account manager. All tiers can bolt on extra CPU, RAM, or storage at published...

Q: What authentication mechanisms does the REST API use?
A: All API calls require an HTTP `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header. Tokens are issued via the OAuth 2.0 client-credentials flow and expire after two hours. Refresh tokens last 30 days and can be rotated via the **API Keys** page.

question: What security measures do you have?

Semantic Only.answer: The platform has several security measures in place. All network traffic is encrypted with TLS 1.3. Data at rest is encrypted using AES-256 with keys managed by AWS KMS. They also run quarterly penetration tests and daily vulnerability scans, and multi-factor authentication (MFA) is supported via TOTP apps like Authy, Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator, and hardware keys such as YubiKey and Feitian. Additionally, deleted resources enter a 14-day soft-delete state before being purged in line with GDPR requirements.
Semantic Only.context:
Q: How is my data protected in transit and at rest?
A: All network traffic is encrypted with TLS 1.3. Data at rest in our block, object, and database storage is encrypted using AES-256 with keys managed by AWS KMS. We run quarterly penetration tests and daily vulnerability scans, and results are available under NDA.

Q: What multi-factor authentication (MFA) options do you support?
A: CloudSphere supports TOTP apps (Authy, Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator) and hardware keys via WebA...

A: All network traffic is encrypted with TLS 1.3. Data at rest in our block, object, and database storage is encrypted using AES-256 with keys managed by AWS KMS. We run quarterly penetration tests and daily vulnerability scans, and results are available under NDA.

metadata.question: How is my data protected in transit and at rest?

raw_results.content:
Q: What multi-factor authentication (MFA) options do you support?
A: CloudSphere supports TOTP apps (Authy, Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator) and hardware keys via WebAuthn (YubiKey, Feitian). Administrators can enforce MFA for the entire organisation under **Settings → Security Policies**.

metadata.question: What multi-factor authentication (MFA) options do you support?

BM25 Only.answer: CloudSphere has several security measures in place. They are SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001, GDPR, and HIPAA-ready. For multi-factor authentication (MFA), they support TOTP apps like Authy, Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator, and hardware keys via WebAuthn (YubiKey, Feitian). Additionally, administrators can enforce MFA for the entire organization under **Settings → Security Policies**. For payment methods, they accept Visa, Mastercard, American Express, PayPal, ACH transfers for invoices over $1,000, and net-30 wire transfers for enterprise customers upon arrangement.

question: How do I troubleshoot when something goes wrong?

Semantic Only.answer:
To troubleshoot when something goes wrong, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the deployment in the console and inspect the build logs for error codes. Click *View full log* to download a 14-day log archive. Common issues are documented at [https://docs.cloudsphere.com/troubleshooting](https://docs.cloudsphere.com/troubleshooting).
2. If you're stuck, email a log snippet and deployment ID to [support@cloudsphere.com](mailto:support@cloudsphere.com); typical response time is under 30 minutes during business hours.

For real-time monitoring of platform status, visit [https://status.cloudsphere.com] or subscribe to email, SMS, or Slack notifications.
Semantic Only.context:
Q: How do I troubleshoot a failed deployment?
A: First, open the deployment in the console and inspect the build logs for error codes (e.g., `E101 Docker build failed`). Click *View full log* to download a 14-day log archive. Common issues—such as missing `Dockerfile`—are documented at [https://docs.cloudsphere.com/troubleshooting](https://docs.cloudsphere.com/troubleshooting). If you’re stuck, email a log snippet and deployment ID to [support@cloudsphere.com](mailto:support@cloudsphere.com); ty...

If you’re stuck, email a log snippet and deployment ID to [support@cloudsphere.com](mailto:support@cloudsphere.com); typical response time is under 30 minutes during business hours.

Q: When are scheduled maintenance windows, and how will I be notified?
A: Routine maintenance occurs Sundays 02:00–04:00 UTC. We post a status page advisory and send email notices at least seven days prior. Enterprise customers receive a 30-day custom maintenance calendar.

If you’re stuck, email a log snippet and deployment ID to [support@cloudsphere.com](mailto:support@cloudsphere.com); ty...

raw_results.content:
Q: How do I troubleshoot a failed deployment?
A: First, open the deployment in the console and inspect the build logs for error codes (e.g., `E101 Docker build failed`). Click *View full log* to download a 14-day log archive. Common issues—such as missing `Dockerfile`—are documented at [https://docs.cloudsphere.com/troubleshooting](https://docs.cloudsphere.com/troubleshooting). If you’re stuck, email a log snippet and deployment ID to [support@cloudsphere.com](mailto:support@cloudsphere.com); typical response time is under 30 minutes during business hours.

metadata.question: How do I troubleshoot a failed deployment?

raw_results.content:
Q: How can I request permanent data erasure when closing my account?
A: Submit a **Right to Erasure** request from **Settings → Privacy**, or email [privacy@cloudsphere.com](mailto:privacy@cloudsphere.com) with your organisation ID. We will complete erasure within 30 days and send written confirmation once all backups age out.

metadata.question: How can I request permanent data erasure when closing my account?

Semantic Only.answer: The API rate limits for each organization are by default 10 requests per second and 100,000 requests per day. Burst requests are queued and return a **429 Too Many Requests** response with a `Retry-After` header. For more details or to request higher limits, enterprise customers can contact the service for no extra cost.

raw_results.content:
Q: What authentication mechanisms does the REST API use?
A: All API calls require an HTTP `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header. Tokens are issued via the OAuth 2.0 client-credentials flow and expire after two hours. Refresh tokens last 30 days and can be rotated via the **API Keys** page.

metadata.question: What authentication mechanisms does the REST API use?

Semantic Only.answer: Your information is quite secure in our system. All network traffic is encrypted with TLS 1.3, and data at rest is encrypted using AES-256 with keys managed by AWS KMS. We also perform quarterly penetration tests and daily vulnerability scans to ensure the security of your data.
Semantic Only.context:
Q: How is my data protected in transit and at rest?
A: All network traffic is encrypted with TLS 1.3. Data at rest in our block, object, and database storage is encrypted using AES-256 with keys managed by AWS KMS. We run quarterly penetration tests and daily vulnerability scans, and results are available under NDA.

metadata.question: How is my data protected in transit and at rest?

raw_results.content:
Q: What is your data retention policy for deleted resources?
A: Deleted databases and file objects enter a 14-day soft-delete state, during which you can self-restore without opening a ticket. After 14 days, data is purged from primary storage and off-site backups within 30 days, in line with GDPR requirements.

metadata.question: What is your data retention policy for deleted resources?

Q: How do I request a custom feature or roadmap update?
A: Open a feature request in the feedback portal at [https://feedback.cloudsphere.com](https://feedback.cloudsphere.com), vote on existing ideas, or email [product@cloudsphere.com](mailto:product@cloudsphere.com) with detailed use-cases. Semantic Only.answer: Yes, that's correct! The Professional pricing tier is $149 per month as stated in the context you provided.
Semantic Only.context:
Q: Which products and add-ons are included in each pricing tier?
A: **Essential** (\$49 / month) covers 2 vCPU, 4 GB RAM, 100 GB storage, and community support. **Professional** (\$149 / month) raises limits to 8 vCPU, 16 GB RAM, 500 GB storage, adds autoscaling, and 24 × 5 chat support. **Enterprise** (from \$499 / month) offers dedicated clusters, unlimited storage, custom SLAs, SAML-based SSO, and a named technical account manager. All tiers can bolt on extra CPU, RAM, or storage at published...

raw_results.content:
Q: Which products and add-ons are included in each pricing tier?
A: **Essential** (\$49 / month) covers 2 vCPU, 4 GB RAM, 100 GB storage, and community support. **Professional** (\$149 / month) raises limits to 8 vCPU, 16 GB RAM, 500 GB storage, adds autoscaling, and 24 × 5 chat support. **Enterprise** (from \$499 / month) offers dedicated clusters, unlimited storage, custom SLAs, SAML-based SSO, and a named technical account manager. All tiers can bolt on extra CPU, RAM, or storage at published overage rates in the console.

metadata.question: Which products and add-ons are included in each pricing tier?

raw_results.content:
Q: How often will I be billed, and in which currency?
A: Invoices are generated monthly on the calendar day you first subscribed. Charges are in US dollars (USD). Enterprise contracts can opt for quarterly or annual invoicing in USD, EUR, or GBP.

metadata.question: How often will I be billed, and in which currency?

BM25 Only.answer: The Professional tier of our service is priced at $149 per month, as stated in your question. However, for new organizations, the first 14 days come with a free trial and $100 in platform credits, without requiring a credit card. After the trial period, if you choose to continue with the service, you will be billed at the monthly rate of $149, as mentioned earlier. The invoices are generated on a monthly basis, and charges are in US dollars (USD).
